intro: Tapinanthus acacietorum, commonly known as the parasitic acacia dodder, is a flowering plant in the family Orobanchaceae. It is a hemiparasitic species, meaning it derives some of its nutrients from a host plant while also performing photosynthesis. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and has a slender, twining stem that attaches to its host. It typically parasitizes acacia trees and other shrubs in arid and semi-arid regions. Due to its parasitic nature, it can significantly affect the growth and health of its host plants.
